fields.description:
We are currently investigating an issue with the JIRA SOAP interface, and our conclusions are as follows:-

With Jira 3.13.2, the SOAP method progressWorkFlowAction can be used to resolve an issue without providing a value for the Resolution field. The default value is then applied to the Resolution field, which in our case is "Fixed".

However, with Jira 3.13.3, this no longer appears to be the case, and a value for the Resolution field has to be provided when resolving an issue through the SOAP interface, even though there is a default value.

There appears to be no reference to this change in functionality in the release notes, and we would like to understand if this is an intentional change, which will require us to update our own code to work around this change in behaviour.

Ideally, we would like progressWorkFlowAction to work the same through the web interface and the SOAP interface, i.e. if no Resolution is provided, then the default is taken.
fields.summary: SOAP method progressWorkFlowAction shows different behaviour in JIRA 3.13.3 compared to 3.13.2

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

I encounter some performance problems with Issue Filer Management.
In our instance, as Administrator, I am able to see many Filters (8 filters per Project and more than 200 projects).
Due to theses figures, in JIRA 3.10, I did use any more the Filter Portlet.
Since JIRA 3.13.x, I encouter the same performance problems, for the Portlet (normal !) but also for the ManageFilters page.
It appears a priori that each filter is systematically executed in order to provide the Issue count.

May we consider an enhancement of these two features (Portlet and ManageFilters page), where Issue count are calculated pertiodically and stored in order to have the figures as estimate values, but not systematically recalculated.

Perhaps, we may have a property (on user scope) allowing or not to display reevalatued values.

Similar Issues : http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-8106

Vincent
fields.summary: Bad Performance due to Issue Cont recalculation in Portlet and ManageFilters

fields.description:
Hello,

when using the Projct Import feature to move a Project from one Jira instance to another, it will copy over the Issue statuses from the source as-is without performing any adaptation to the statuses defined in the target. This is deliberate (see JRA-16947) and any entry previous to the _ProjectImport_ that is set in the process should be taken for historical value but may not be consistent with the current setup.

Documentation ([Restoring a Projet from Backup|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13.2/restore_project.html]) doesn't seem to mention this aspect and should be updated.

Best Regards,
Edoardo

fields.description:
After upgrading RPC JIRA Plugin from version 3.13.1 to 3.13.3 some of our scripts were broken because neither the deprecated {{getIssuesFromFilter}} function nor its substitute {{getIssuesFromFilterWithLimit}} stopped working.

I'm attaching a Perl script ({{jirabug.pl}}) to show the bug. It depends on the {{SOAP::Lite}} module and you have to edit it to inform the JIRA base URL, a user, a password, and the name of a filter. Running it here I get this:

{noformat}
gnu$ ./jirabug.pl
getIssuesFromFilter
soapenv:Server.userException, java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
gnu$
gnu$ ./jirabug.pl 1
getIssuesFromFilterWithLimit
soapenv:Server.userException, java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
{noformat}

Without arguments it uses the {{getIssuesFromFilter}} functions. With any argument it uses the {{getIssuesFromFilterWithLimit}} function. As you can see, both of them cause an exception.

I'm attaching another file ({{stacktrace.gz}}) containing the detailed stacktrace from the exception. I got it from the {{getIssuesFromFilterWithLimit}} call. It's a Perl structure, but pretty clear I guess.

We're going to downgrade the plugin version to see if it gets us back to a working state. I'll report on that later after having been able to restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Cannot getIssuesFromFilter after upgrading to RPC JIRA Plugin 3.13.3

fields.description:
The Plugins2 system in JIRA4 appears to be leaking heap and permgen when restarting it.

Restarting [Plugins2|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/PLUGINFRAMEWORK20/Plugin+Framework] (in JIRA this happens when doing a full system import) when there are active Plugins2 plugins does not allow all memory previously referenced to be available for GC, most particularly there are a number of ClassLoaders left active with no obvious GC root the classes of whom  are themselves roots for a whole graph of circularly referenced garbage. The plugins do not have to have been used for the leak to occur. There is not a one-one correspondence to restarts and leaks however (we generally see about 6 dead plugin systems although 30 or more restarts may have occured).

In the process of diagnosing this we have tracked down and removed every possible reference to a large section of memory (a plugin framework) that we could find. Starting with all strong references and proceeding to remove soft and weak references - even things like clearing the java.lang.reflect.Proxy cache - and even Finalizer references until YourKit, Eclipse MAT, JProfiler and jhat profilers all report that the memory in question is dead and should be collectable, but inexplicably _the JVM still holds on to it_. There are no JNI Global references either, yet this memory remains uncollectable!

This happens on all JVMs we have tried so far, which are the 1.5 and 1.6 JVMs on Linux and Mac, and the IBM 1.6 JDK on Linux.

In practice this doesn't hurt a standard JIRA customer as a full system import is generally a one-off operation. It seriously affects runs of our functional test suite.

This is [a JVM GC bug (4957990)|http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4957990]. No known memory analysis tool can find the heap root (i.e. according to "the rules" there is no heap root). Are there any known GC memory leaks caused by ClassLoaders being dropped for instance?

The application is creating and disposing a lot of ClassLoaders via OSGi (Apache Felix) with Spring OSGi. It creates a lot of java.lang.reflect.Proxy class instances.

Strictly speaking this is *not actually a memory leak* as the additional memory use is bounded - memory use does not go up forever.
fields.summary: Memory Leak in Sun JVM tripped by Plugins2

fields.description:
If SOAP or the TransitionWorkflow Jelly tag is use to progress and issue through a workflow step, then the existing issue values can be ignored n the process.

This is related to JRA-16112 and JRA-16859 which are attempts to make Resolution field act like it does on the web page. 

This issue is a placeholder for the work needed to fix this and more importantly test it up the wazoo.

In a nutshell the SOAP and Jellt tags need to populate the FieldHolderValues map before calling WorkflowTransitionUtil.

However the big guy is afraid that the objects a custom field places into the FHV on populateFromIssue() may NOT be the same objects that are placed into the FHV via populateFromParams() 

And hence this could lead to class cast exceptions and the like.

We need to re-implement Dylans change JRA-16112 with the populateFromIssue() call and then a bucket load of testing on All the field and all the CustomField types to prove that no problems will arise in the possible populateFromIssue()/populateFromParams() mismatch.
fields.summary: SOAP and Jelly Progress Workflow calls do not take into account exisiting issue values

fields.description:
Hello,

whatever value is inserted in a Custom Field type "Number Field" the data will be correctly stored in the database as intended:
{noformat}
centos02-jira=# SELECT * FROM customfieldvalue ;
  id   | issue | customfield | parentkey | stringvalue | numbervalue | textvalue | datevalue | valuetype 
-------+-------+-------------+-----------+-------------+-------------+-----------+-----------+-----------
 10022 | 10000 |       10000 |           |             |     0.12345 |           |           | 
 10031 | 10020 |       10000 |           |             |    0.123456 |           |           | 
{noformat}
but will be truncated to the 3rd decimal place on the issue screen.

If the file {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/fields/view/view-number.vm}} is amended with a format string like so:
{noformat}
#if ($value)
    $!numberTool.format("0000000000000000.000000", $value)
#end
{noformat}
the value will be displayed properly (note however that it will give an error if the encoding string contains '#' wich would be preferable as it would omit unnecessary '0's).

The value will then be rendered truncated once again in the "edit issue" screen and if saved will overwrite the database with the wrong value. The responsible macro should be: {{/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/fields/edit/edit-number.vm}}.

Please let me know if you require further information

Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Custom Field "Number Field" is truncated to the 3rd decimal place

fields.description:
Hi, we have about many log messages like the above, of which there are 7 unique. I doubt this is causing a problem but I want to get rid of them to make support easier.

Note, the 7 groups mentioned are all in fact user names, I've no idea how they got in there.

The problem is there is no way to do this using the API. com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.OfBizProjectRoleAndActorStore#updateProjectRoleActors doesn't work, because it subtracts the records in the cache from what you pass in, however, any group params that don't exist are already discarded (line 398).

Therefore the only way seems to be using the database, or using the OfBizDelegator directly. I ran the following query, hopefully it's OK.

{code:sql}
delete from projectroleactor 
where projectroleactor.id in (
	SELECT projectroleactor.ID
	FROM projectroleactor 
		INNER JOIN project ON projectroleactor.PID = project.ID 
		INNER JOIN projectrole ON projectroleactor.PROJECTROLEID = projectrole.ID 
		LEFT OUTER JOIN groupbase ON projectroleactor.ROLETYPEPARAMETER = groupbase.groupname
	WHERE (projectroleactor.ROLETYPE = N'atlassian-group-role-actor') AND (groupbase.groupname IS NULL)
)
{code}

fields.description:
Bugzilla has a nice feature whereby existing attachments can be marked as superseded when adding a new attachment.

The superseded attachments are not removed, but they are shown in a strike-through font.

The old attachments can still be downloaded (which can be very useful at times), but it is very obvious that they are current.

Very simple, but effective.
fields.summary: Allow attachments to be marked as superseded

fields.description: It would be very useful for a user to set his e-mail notification preferences according to an issue priority, issue component, etc.   For example, we have coded that assignee's get e-mail notifications throughout our customized workflow, but it would be handy for the user preferences to offer up more options than are currently set.  Ideally, we would like individual users to be able to turn e-mail off entirely, or to be selectively notified for certain types of issues with a high priority or for a particular component.
fields.summary: Please add e-mail notification preferences at the individual user level
Filter subscription by project role

fields.description:
Hi,

The notification for 'Issue commented' can be a little confusing.

To minimize the amount of notifications being sent from JIRA,we use the following rule of thumb:

"Any comment that's added, will result in a notification to the current/new assignee."

This works fine if you add a comment seperately, but not if you add a comment when performing an issue operation like Assigning the issue. In the latter case only a 'Issue Assigned' Notification is being sent. 

This confuses users in pour scenario. 

I think it would be an improvement to also sent an 'Issue Commented' Notification in this case.

If you think this would be over the top (too much), you could select those recipients for the 'Issue Commented' notification if they didn't already receive the 'Issue assigned' mail (which includes the new comment already). You could also add the recicipients from the 'notification scheme-issue commented' to the recipients of the 'Issue Assigned' Notificiation mail, but this could cause confusion because of the e-mail subject.

Please share your thoughts on this.
fields.summary: An 'Issue commented'  notification should always be sent for a new comment, also on issue operation/transition.

fields.description: The due date is currently visible under Summary of an Issue. The size of the font is quiet small and many a times this is missed by the users. Apart from it's current position, At least this date field should be visible on the screen with other fields (Custom & Jira Default).
fields.summary: Due date should be shown on View Issue screen also.

fields.description:
In Jira 3.13.2, a jira:TransitionWorkflow tag allowed transitions that have a screen with the resolution field, even when the resolution was not specified in the TransitionWorkflow tag. This  worked when issue had a resolution set and when it didn't have it.

JRA-16112 fixed the situation where the resolution was not set, and Jelly allowed the transition to occur. It seems that in fixing that bug, we removed the ability of the TransitionWorkflow to transition if the resolution was already defined. I think the Jelly should allow the transition if the resolution was already set.
fields.summary: Jelly TransitionWorkflow through a workflow transition that uses a screen with the resolution field fails even if resolution is already set on the issue

fields.description: Seems we've re-introduced JRA-13788 in 3.13.3.  This can be replicated on s.a.c. using IE 7.  Seems like the auto-picker still "works" and you can create the issue we just have false under each user picker field.
fields.summary: User name AutoPicker renders a "FALSE" and pushbuttons disappear.

fields.description:
An email handler configured with {{ccwatcher=true}} will correctly add the CCd accounts to the watcher list but won't send them a notification of issue creation.
CreateIssueHandler.handleMessage() (also called from CreateOrCommentHandler) will create the issue without passing the accounts in the CC field and only after that has happened it will add the CCd account; this way the CCd watchers will miss the event.
I think the method should extract the eventual CCs and pass them to the IssueManager.createIssue() together with the other fields (if possible)

Best regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Email handler configured with ccwatcher option won't notify of issue creation

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

It appears that the problem reported in JRA-12039 is back with JIRA 3.13, but only for one ressource.

*Environement :* IBM Websphere 6.1.0.11 / Oracle
*Side Effect :* The Calendar is in transpency.
!calendar.without.css.png!

*Root Cause :* The request for its CSS (calendar.css) fails with a 404

*First Analyse :*
The failed request is http://mydomain/jira/s/330/1/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:calendar/calendar.css
But the others also fail :
* http://mydomain/jira/download/resources/jira.webresources:calendar/calendar.css
* http://mydomain/jira/styles/calendar.css

However the other one succeed :
* http://mydomain/jira/s/330/1/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:calendar/calendar.js
* http://mydomain/jira/download/resources/jira.webresources:calendar/calendar.js
* http://mydomain/jira/styles/global.css
* http://mydomain/jira/styles/combined.css

It appears that the usage of *com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.invokefilterscompatibility=true* in Websphere WEB Container has not effect for my issue !

After some tests (remote debug), it appears that 
* ResourceDownloadUtils defined in UrlRewriter configuration is , with an empty browser cache, well called and served for
   http://mydomain/jira/s/330/1/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:calendar/calendar.js
 but not for 
   http://mydomain/jira/s/330/1/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:calendar/calendar.css

* FileServerServlet is also well called and well served for
   http://mydomain/jira/s/330/1/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:calendar/calendar.js
   http://mydomain/jira/download/resources/jira.webresources:calendar/calendar.js
 well called, and not served for 
   http://mydomain/jira/download/resources/jira.webresources:calendar/calendar.css
 but not called for 
   http://mydomain/jira/s/330/1/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:calendar/calendar.css

I tried to call direclty http://mydomain/jira/styles/global.css, but no return occurs.
Finally, when calling directly http://mydomain/jira/includes/js/calendar/skins/aqua/theme.jsp, the CSS is provided.

For an non-identified reason, with the 2 following servlet : 
{code:xml}<servlet-mapping>
   <servlet-name>calendar.css</servlet-name>
   <url-pattern>/styles/calendar.css</url-pattern>
</servlet-mapping>
<servlet>
    <servlet-name>calendar.css</servlet-name>
    <jsp-file>/includes/js/calendar/skins/aqua/theme.jsp</jsp-file>
    <init-param>
        <param-name>fork</param-name>
        <param-value>false</param-value>
    </init-param>
</servlet>{code}
and 
{code:xml}<servlet-mapping>
   <servlet-name>global.css</servlet-name>
   <url-pattern>/styles/global.css</url-pattern>
</servlet-mapping>
<servlet>
   <servlet-name>global.css</servlet-name>
   <jsp-file>/styles/global_css.jsp</jsp-file>
   <init-param>
      <param-name>fork</param-name>
      <param-value>false</param-value>
   </init-param>
</servlet>{code}

the first fail in fowarding to the JSP where the other success ???????

I do not find real link with JRA-3915, JRA-3747 or JRA-4322.

HELP !!!!!!!!!
fields.summary: Calendar.css web-resource not served with  WebSphere 6.1.0.11

fields.description: We need to move the search sorts off the search request and into the SearchQuery. This should be as part of an order by clause and should be a part of the JQL string. This means that we should be able to parse the order by and turn it into search sort objects.

fields.description:
When creating or editing an issue with a screen configuration containing multiple Tabs, selecting any but the default one will result in the contained fields to not display.

Problem is that JIRA will identify the browser and set the html header element {{<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=EmulateIE7" />
}} putting the client in compatibility mode, all of  which will exhibit the faulty behavior.

Surprisingly, forcing the browser to {{Browser mode: IE8}} and {{Document mode: IE8 standards}} (definitions from Internet Explorer debug console) will render the forms correctly

Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Microsoft Internet Explorer 8 will not render Issue screen tabs correctly if not in IE8 standards compliant mode

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

What is the usefull reason to have merged these two notions ?

Now, to be able to log a Work, a user needs to have the Worklog Permission and the Timetraking Field available in the screen !

The *Timetraking Field* is not a Permission, but only a way to show or not the Cumulative Timetracking fields.

A more usefull solution should be to implement a *SHOW WORKLOG* permission !
fields.summary: Worklog creation is now dependant of Worklog Permission but also of Timetracknig field presence.

fields.description:
Set up a project with some open or closed issues.
Go to jira/browse/PROJNAME and click on either the Open or Closed link on the right side.
On the Sun or Oracle jvm you'll get back a page with each open or closed issue listed. With IBM running the same Tomcat stack, you will not see any issues.
Note that some things like logins and get system info still work fine.
No errors are logged in the server for the IBM behavior

Behavior is reproducible when remote debugging is enabled. Removing the {{-Xdebug - Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,address=8000,server=y,suspend=n}} command line options will return application to normal behavior.
fields.summary: Abnormal behavior on IBM JDK 1.6 with remote debugging enabled

fields.description:
RSS link produces harmless but incorrect urls.

When JIRA creates url's like this: http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?view=rss&reset=true&decorator=none&updated%3Aprevious=-0w+177m&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=ASC&pid=10560&pager/start=0&tempMax=10

It will automatically redirected users to: http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?&reset=true&decorator=none&updated%3Aprevious=-0w+177m&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=ASC&pid=10560&pager/start=0&tempMax=10
It's got the ?& in the URL


This is continuation of JRA-13936
fields.summary: IssueNavigator produces harmless but incorrect urls that result in logging messages

fields.description:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/secure/admin/jira/ViewLookAndFeel.jspa

In IE:
- when I select a colour in the popup box, it has no effect.

In Firefox:
- when I select a colour in the popup box, the new colour's ID is propagated to the main screen before I click the "OK" button in the popup box.

NB. Two additional, trivial items:
- "Header Separator Color" should be "Colour" (for consistency with the other wording on this screen)
- There is inconsistency in placement of the word "Highlight" in "Header Highlight Background Colour" vs."Header Text Highlight Colour"
- There is inconsistency in placement of the word "Highlight" in "Navigation Bar Highlight Background Colour" vs."Navigation Bar Text Highlight Colour"
fields.summary: Colour picker (in Admin > Look and Feel) doesn't work in IE. And works too well in Firefox.

fields.summary: Decorator plugin point

fields.description:
The login form is hard coded to redirect the user to "/secure/" if no os_destination parameter is specified in the request.  To allow JIRA to be better integrated with other applications, where the JIRA dashboard may not be the desired "home" page after login, this URL needs to be configurable.

For the purposes of JIRA Studio, it needs to be stored in database (so that it can be configured by customers through a web interface).
fields.summary: Configurable redirection URL after login

fields.description:
All fields should be editable in the way that Labels are editable.  (via a click "EDIT" button next to the labels and then modify the field in a pop up window

Once you edit a Label this way you shed tears of pain that the other fields are not this way.

The Labels plugin has the correct idea in how a field should be editable.   I don't have to have a new page open with lots of extra data that I don't care about.

Just the item I want to edit with a single click!

If I want to edit the bug in more detail THEN I click the "Edit this issue" link.


This type of editing should exist on ALL pages except the "Edit this issue" page :-)
fields.summary: All fields should be editable in the way that Labels are editable.  (via a click "EDIT" button and then modify the field in a pop up window
